cinemaDescriptions.title: The Green Mile
cinemaDescriptions.description: A prisoner with a divine gift appears in a death row prison. A mystical drama based on the novel by Stephen King
cinemaDescriptions.story: Paul Edgecombe is the head of the death row unit at the Cold Mountain prison, each of whose prisoners once passes the "green mile" on the way to the place of execution. Paul has seen a lot of prisoners and guards during his work. However, the giant John Coffey, accused of a terrible crime, became one of the most unusual inhabitants of the block.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Forrest Gump
cinemaDescriptions.description: A half-century history of the USA through the eyes of an eccentric from Alabama. Absolute Classics by Robert Zemeckis with Tom Hanks
cinemaDescriptions.story: Sitting at the bus stop, Forrest Gump — not very smart, but a kind and open guy — tells random people the story of his extraordinary life.Since he was very young, the guy suffered from a leg disease, the neighborhood boys teased him, but one day Forrest discovered his incredible ability to run. His childhood friend Jenny always supported and protected him, but soon their paths diverged.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Breaking Bad
cinemaDescriptions.description: A prisoner with a divine gift appears in a death row prison. A mystical drama based on the novel by Stephen King
cinemaDescriptions.story: School chemistry teacher Walter White finds out that he has lung cancer. Given the difficult financial state of the family's affairs, as well as prospects, Walter decides to start making methamphetamine. To do this, he enlists his former student Jesse Pinkman, who was once expelled from school with the active assistance of White. Pinkman himself was engaged in cooking meth, but the day before, during a DEA raid, he lost an accomplice and a laboratory.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Back to the Future
cinemaDescriptions.description: A mad scientist and a 17-year-old blockhead are testing a time machine, causing a stir in the 1950s. Classics of film fiction
cinemaDescriptions.story: Teenager Marty, with the help of a time machine built by his friend, Professor Doc Brown, gets from the 80s to the distant 50s. There he meets his future parents, still teenagers, and a friend, a professor, very young.

cinemaDescriptions.title: The Sopranos
cinemaDescriptions.description: A gangster goes to therapy to sort himself out. The HBO series that started the golden era of television
cinemaDescriptions.story: The daily life of a modern Godfather: his thoughts are swift, his actions are decisive, and his humor is black. Mafia boss of North Jersey Tony Soprano successfully copes with the problems of the "Family". But my own family has let me down a little: the children have strayed from the hands, the marriage is under threat, the mother is sawing. He hopes for the help of a psychotherapist, but how can he tell about all his problems if he is bound by omerta — a vow of silence, which cannot be broken on pain of death?

cinemaDescriptions.title: Interstellar
cinemaDescriptions.description: A prisoner with a divine gift appears in a death row prison. A mystical drama based on the novel by Stephen King
cinemaDescriptions.story: When drought, dust storms and the extinction of plants lead humanity to a food crisis, a team of researchers and scientists goes through a wormhole (which supposedly connects the regions of space-time over a long distance) on a journey to surpass the previous limitations for human space travel and find a planet with suitable conditions for humanity.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Pulp Fiction
cinemaDescriptions.description: Several related stories from the life of bandits. Quentin Tarantino's Masterpiece that Changed World Cinema
cinemaDescriptions.story: Two bandits Vincent Vega and Jules Winfield have philosophical conversations in between showdowns and solving problems with the debtors of criminal boss Marcellus Wallace. In the first story, Vincent spends an unforgettable evening with Marcellas' wife Mia. The second tells about the boxer Butch Coolidge, bought by Wallace to give up the fight. In the third story, Vincent and Jules accidentally get into trouble.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Frieds
cinemaDescriptions.description: A prisoner with a divine gift appears in a death row prison. A mystical drama based on the novel by Stephen King
cinemaDescriptions.story: Six friends –Rachel, Monica, Phoebe, Joey, Chandler and Ross – live next door, kill time together, share secrets and sometimes fall very much in love.

cinemaDescriptions.title: The Lion King
cinemaDescriptions.description: The lion cub Simba challenges the killer uncle. Majestic soundtrack, hand-drawn animation and Shakespearean scope
cinemaDescriptions.story: The majestic Lion King Mufasa has an heir named Simba. Already in childhood, an inquisitive kid becomes a victim of the intrigues of his envious uncle Scar, who dreams of power.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Avatar: The Way of Water
cinemaDescriptions.description: A prisoner with a divine gift appears in a death row prison.
cinemaDescriptions.story: After adopting the avatar image of a soldier, Jake Sully becomes the leader of the Na'vi people and takes on a mission to protect new friends from mercenary businessmen from Earth. Now he has someone to fight for — his beautiful beloved Neytiri with Jake. When heavily armed Earthlings return to Pandora, Jake is ready to fight them back.

cinemaDescriptions.title: The Amazing Maurice
cinemaDescriptions.description: A prisoner with a divine gift appears in a death row prison.
cinemaDescriptions.story: Maurice the cat has two talents: talking and pulling scams. Traveling with talking rodents from city to city, he "saves" the locals from the invasion of rats every time (of course, for a good fee). But once in the Trash-Blinzburg, Maurice and his friends realize that this town is fraught with something dangerous. Now they have to play cat and mouse with real evil and solve the main mystery of this place - to the amazement of all the bipeds living there.

cinemaDescriptions.title: The Gentlemen
cinemaDescriptions.description: The drug lord wants to retire, but the criminal world does not let him go. Guy Ritchie's Successful Return to the Roots
cinemaDescriptions.story: One smart American had been dealing drugs since his student years, and now he came up with a scheme for illegal enrichment using the estates of the impoverished English aristocracy and got rich very well on it.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Top Gun: Maverick
cinemaDescriptions.description: A prisoner with a divine gift appears in a death row prison.
cinemaDescriptions.story: There is uncertainty ahead, and the ghosts of the past are behind us. Maverick is forced to confront his deepest fears, which threaten to come to life as part of a mission that requires exceptional dedication from those who will be assigned to the flight.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Inception
cinemaDescriptions.description: A prisoner with a divine gift appears in a death row prison.
cinemaDescriptions.story: But no amount of planning or skill can prepare a team to face a dangerous opponent who seems to anticipate their every move. An enemy that only Cobb could see.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Fight Club
cinemaDescriptions.description: An insurance worker destroys the routine of his prosperous life. Cult drama based on the book by Chuck Palahniuk
cinemaDescriptions.story: A little time passes, and now new friends are beating each other for nothing in the parking lot in front of the bar, and the cleansing fight gives them the highest bliss. Introducing other men to the simple joys of physical cruelty, they found a secret Fight Club, which is beginning to enjoy incredible popularity.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Intouchables
cinemaDescriptions.description: An insurance worker destroys the routine of his prosperous life. Cult drama based on the book by Chuck Palahniuk
cinemaDescriptions.story: Having suffered an accident, the wealthy aristocrat Philip hires the person who is least suitable for this job as an assistant – a young resident of the suburb of Drissa, who has just been released from prison. Despite the fact that Philip is confined to a wheelchair, Driss manages to bring the spirit of adventure into the measured life of an aristocrat.

cinemaDescriptions.title: The Dark Knight
cinemaDescriptions.description: An insurance worker destroys the routine of his prosperous life. Cult drama based on the book by Chuck Palahniuk
cinemaDescriptions.story: Batman raises the stakes in the war on crime. With the help of Lieutenant Jim Gordon and Prosecutor Harvey Dent, he intends to clear the streets of Gotham of crime. Cooperation proves effective, but soon they will find themselves in the midst of chaos unleashed by a rising criminal genius known to frightened townspeople as the Joker.

cinemaDescriptions.title: WALL·E
cinemaDescriptions.description: People left the Earth and left the robot to collect garbage for them. Pixar's Ecological Masterpiece
cinemaDescriptions.story: Robot WALL·E from year to year, he diligently works on the deserted Earth, cleaning our planet from the mountains of garbage that people who flew into space left behind. He has no idea that incredible events will happen very soon, thanks to which he will meet friends, rise to the stars and even be able to change for the better his former owners, who have completely forgotten their native Land.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Gladiator
cinemaDescriptions.description: A brave general who has become a slave takes revenge on the empire. Ridley Scott's Iconic Historical Drama with Five Oscars
cinemaDescriptions.story: In the great Roman Empire there was no military commander equal to General Maximus. The invincible legions commanded by this noble warrior idolized him and could follow him even to hell.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Shameless
cinemaDescriptions.description: The life of a bad dad and his six children. A mix of harsh reality and absurdity in a dramedy about an imperfect family
cinemaDescriptions.story: About a flighty large family of Gallaghers and their neighbors who have fun, get into the most incredible situations and try to survive in this world by all possible means, but at the same time working as little as possible.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Game of Thrones
cinemaDescriptions.description: Knights, dead men and dragons are in an epic battle for the fate of the world. The series that changed television forever
cinemaDescriptions.story: The time of prosperity is coming to an end, and the summer, which lasted almost a decade, is fading. A conspiracy is brewing around the center of power of the Seven Kingdoms, the Iron Throne, and at this difficult time the king decides to seek support from a friend of his youth, Eddard Stark.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Supernatural
cinemaDescriptions.description: The Winchester brothers are trying not to let the demons out. A fantasy series inspired by The Twilight Zone
cinemaDescriptions.story: The series tells about the adventures of brothers Sam and Dean Winchester, who travel across the United States in a black 1967 Chevrolet Impala car, investigate paranormal phenomena, many of which are based on American urban legends and folklore, and fight evil creatures such as demons and ghosts.

cinemaDescriptions.title: The Office
cinemaDescriptions.description: Bored from idleness, clerks are trying to get along with a crazy boss. A virtuoso sitcom about everyday work
cinemaDescriptions.story: The series is about the everyday work of a small regional office of a large company, whose inhabitants have to endure the quirks of their wayward boss for days on end.

cinemaDescriptions.title: Stranger Things
cinemaDescriptions.description: 1980s, a quiet provincial American town. The favorable course of local life is disrupted by the mysterious disappearance of a teenager named Will.
cinemaDescriptions.story: The series is about the everyday work of a small regional office of a large company, whose inhabitants have to endure the quirks of their wayward boss for days on end.

reviews.title: Magic or reality
reviews.text:
The period of the late nineties-the beginning of the two thousandth gave us a large number of great and high-quality films, which until today we review and enjoy every time, The Green Mile directed by Frank Darabont is just one of those films, and which I also recently reviewed. The film is based on Stephen King's novel The Green Mile.

The main role was played by the legendary Tom Hanks, who has long been included in the Hollywood list as one of the best charismatic and talented actors. The events in the film unfold in 1935, Tom played the role of the head of the prison block of death row named Paul Edgecombe. The work is not the most pleasant, because every day you have to deal with disgusting personalities sitting in prison cells, although not all of these personalities are disgusting, some of them look quite normal people, but you never know what they are thinking, after all, these people have committed murders, and Paul also has problems with health.

Everything changes when the giant John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan) is brought to prison one day, and from that very moment a lot will change in life for Paul and his work colleagues.

reviews.title: The moment when a dozen negative comments are closer than three hundred positive ones.
reviews.text: Like many people, the second place in the rating of the best films on KINOPOISK made me watch The Green Mile. Since I really love 'Escape from the Shawshank' and have a very good relationship with director Frank Darabont, I sat down to watch with the feeling that I would see another masterpiece. The first notes of bewilderment arose at the sight of flies (?) flying out of John Coffey's mouth, but I thought, okay, this is probably a film with elements of fiction. But gradually my bewilderment turned into a question: how did this film get to the second line?

reviews.title: The magic of pure water
reviews.text:
Very unlike Stephen King: there is no strong horror, cold sweat does not break through, but, as usual, there is not enough strength to break away from the TV screen. This movie is definitely filled with kindness. Kindness and faith. It may be sacrilege what I say, but the character of John Coffey is akin to the biblical Jesus Christ. He is unselfish, infinitely kind and devoid of a certain amount of pretense. This is what captivates. John Coffey does not lie and therefore already acquires a halo over his head, which is visible to each of the prison guards. But everyone reacts to it differently.

The unsurpassed game of Tom Hanks, his hero is perhaps the last thing left of a world without hatred and envy.

The main role was played by the legendary Tom Hanks, who has long been included in the Hollywood list as one of the best charismatic and talented actors. The events in the film unfold in 1935, Tom played the role of the head of the prison block of death row named Paul Edgecombe. The work is not the most pleasant, because every day you have to deal with disgusting personalities sitting in prison cells, although not all of these personalities are disgusting, some of them look quite normal people, but you never know what they are thinking, after all, these people have committed murders, and Paul also has problems with health.

Everything changes when the giant John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan) is brought to prison one day, and from that very moment a lot will change in life for Paul and his work colleagues.

reviews.title: The moment when a dozen negative comments are closer than three hundred positive ones.
reviews.text: Like many people, the second place in the rating of the best films on KINOPOISK made me watch The Green Mile. Since I really love 'Escape from the Shawshank' and have a very good relationship with director Frank Darabont, I sat down to watch with the feeling that I would see another masterpiece. The first notes of bewilderment arose at the sight of flies (?) flying out of John Coffey's mouth, but I thought, okay, this is probably a film with elements of fiction. But gradually my bewilderment turned into a question: how did this film get to the second line?

reviews.title: The magic of pure water
reviews.text:
Very unlike Stephen King: there is no strong horror, cold sweat does not break through, but, as usual, there is not enough strength to break away from the TV screen. This movie is definitely filled with kindness. Kindness and faith. It may be sacrilege what I say, but the character of John Coffey is akin to the biblical Jesus Christ. He is unselfish, infinitely kind and devoid of a certain amount of pretense. This is what captivates. John Coffey does not lie and therefore already acquires a halo over his head, which is visible to each of the prison guards. But everyone reacts to it differently.

The unsurpassed game of Tom Hanks, his hero is perhaps the last thing left of a world without hatred and envy.

The period of the late nineties-the beginning of the two thousandth gave us a large number of great and high-quality films, which until today we review and enjoy every time, The Green Mile directed by Frank Darabont is just one of those films, and which I also recently reviewed. The film is based on Stephen King's novel The Green Mile.

The main role was played by the legendary Tom Hanks, who has long been included in the Hollywood list as one of the best charismatic and talented actors. The events in the film unfold in 1935, Tom played the role of the head of the prison block of death row named Paul Edgecombe. The work is not the most pleasant, because every day you have to deal with disgusting personalities sitting in prison cells, although not all of these personalities are disgusting, some of them look quite normal people, but you never know what they are thinking, after all, these people have committed murders, and Paul also has problems with health.

Everything changes when the giant John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan) is brought to prison one day, and from that very moment a lot will change in life for Paul and his work colleagues.

reviews.title: The moment when a dozen negative comments are closer than three hundred positive ones.
reviews.text: Like many people, the second place in the rating of the best films on KINOPOISK made me watch The Green Mile. Since I really love 'Escape from the Shawshank' and have a very good relationship with director Frank Darabont, I sat down to watch with the feeling that I would see another masterpiece. The first notes of bewilderment arose at the sight of flies (?) flying out of John Coffey's mouth, but I thought, okay, this is probably a film with elements of fiction. But gradually my bewilderment turned into a question: how did this film get to the second line?

reviews.title: The magic of pure water
reviews.text:
Very unlike Stephen King: there is no strong horror, cold sweat does not break through, but, as usual, there is not enough strength to break away from the TV screen. This movie is definitely filled with kindness. Kindness and faith. It may be sacrilege what I say, but the character of John Coffey is akin to the biblical Jesus Christ. He is unselfish, infinitely kind and devoid of a certain amount of pretense. This is what captivates. John Coffey does not lie and therefore already acquires a halo over his head, which is visible to each of the prison guards. But everyone reacts to it differently.

The unsurpassed game of Tom Hanks, his hero is perhaps the last thing left of a world without hatred and envy.
